bibl.title: Sam Pong v. William Billings
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the 2nd Judicial of Washington Territory

div1.p: In the District Court of the 2d Judicial of Washington Territory holding terms at Olympia

In the matter of the application
of
Sam Hong for a writ of habeas corpus to the Honorable John Hoyt Judge of said Court. The petition of Sam Hong respectfully shows that he is unlawfully restrained of his liberty and imprisoned detained and confined by William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County W.T. at Olympia Washington Territory. That said imprisonment detention confinement and restraint are illegal and that the illegality thereof consists of this to wit-: On the 22 day of April 1888 are Kang Jik made a complaint as statement in writing charging this petition with the crime of being
property committed to his alleged to be committed, at Thurston Count W.T. on or about the 20th April 1888 that charge the following is a true copy to wit-:
Territory of Washington County of Thurston} SS
In the Justice Court of Olympia Precinct before W.T. Keady Justice of the Peace Territory of Washington

Sam Hung vs Defendant Hong Yuk being first duly sworn avfores and says that on or about the 20th day of April 1885 at Olympia Thurston County Washington Territory the above named Sam Hung committed the offense of vandelizing property entrusted to for five one in this towit that the said Sam Hung did then and there in the
and petitioner further shows, that thereupon a warrent was issued and petitioner was arrested and taken before the said Justice and duly appeared in said Court by his attorney and filed a ducumence to said complaint which was argued by counsel and the objections to said complaint issue by said Court overruled and defendant by his counsel duly excepted the objections to said complaint argued by petitioners were that the same did not state facts constituting any crime thereafter the examination of petitioner proceeded in said court and witnesses were sworn and examined and their testominy reduced to writing and which testimony is as follows: "April 23 1883 10 o'clock AM court called NS Torter for territory, JC McFadden & A.W. Bartmane & for Defendant

lawfully events of one Kong Mck for a specific pupose towit for the collection of a certian draft fraudulently uncarefully and designedly concuth his cut use and embezzled the sum of $60.05 of said draft, the property of said Kong Mck within that to steal and comment larcery of said sum of money, all of which is contrary to the form and effect of the stattute in such case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the People of Washington Territory. Wherefore the said Haing Yek prays that a warrant may issue for the avers of the said Sam Hung and that he may be dealt with according to law.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 22d day of April 1885 (signed) W.T. Keady Justice of the Peace

And the said examination being concluded and argument of counsel cleared the said Justice of the Peace committed your petitioner to the County jail of Thurston County in default of bail the sum of $15.00 to await the acting of the Grand Jury upon said charge, and thereupon, ussed a warrant in words and by me as follows to wit-
